intro: Diplycosia kinabaluensis, commonly known as the Kinabalu diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Mount Kinabalu in Borneo. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its mountainous habitat. It is often found in cloud forests, where it thrives in the shade of taller trees. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
